ratings.comment: GB 307 has 2 professors, he covered the first half, I really liked him!! He is helpful in office hours and I thought the material was interesting, but you do need to put time into the class watching his lectures and doing the weekly activities. I learned a lot in the class and thought he was a really nice, cool professor!

His lectures were fairly interactive even in this virtual format. I think he does a pretty good job of explaining the concepts. He is a bit of a hardo though and over the top in what he expects you to know for certain concepts. His midterm is a time crunch, so make sure to do his practice exams. I made silly mistakes on the midterm. Practice SQL

Firstly, rick-rolled the whole class by faking that he leaked the exam answers. It was really funny. But he is a great dude who makes the content mostly understandable. There are a lot of videos/lectures each week though but they aren't too bad. There are also some long "quizzes" that you can work on with friends. Overall, solid choice.
Hoban is a very good lecturer. He wants to make sure his students get the material, and is extremely helpful if you ask questions. Very nice guy, and a good teacher

Paul is an interesting guy, but his lectures are kind of a mess. He moves quickly, flipping through slides and excel examples. It's impossible to keep up. The average score on his midterm was a D. Make sure you take the weekly activities seriously and do the prep work.

I liked Paul a lot more than the prof for the 2nd half of the course (they switch). 25% of your grade comes from the weekly CLC activities, 50% comes from the 2 exams, 20% comes from the 2 hw assignments, and 5% comes from the weekly quizzes (very simple). Exams are hard, the average for the midterm was a D. Hard class, but doable. Easier than 306!

Most of the class was composed of completing weekly activities. One day of the week is lecture and the other is working inside the computer lab. You can work with other students so the activities aren't too difficult. Just takes a lot of outside prep work. Watch the online videos and take notes. The reading isn't that beneficial for the class.
Professor Hoban is very straight-forward, uses real-world data, and is super helpful when you ask clarifying questions! Very good at explaining and I really liked him overall

Professor Hoban was THE BEST professor I have had at UW. The skills I learned in his class have been impactful throughout my internships and other class work. His lectures are thought-provoking, insightful, and technological advanced. I would highly recommend him as a professor. Although the class was challenging, it was well worth the time.

Analytics is taught by both Prof. Hoban and Prof. Hernke.  I personally enjoyed Prof. Hoban more and he brings a lot of great experience to the table.  There is one lecture a week and he is a great lecturer.  Then in the second lecture there is an excel case you work on to apply the knowledge from lecture.  Great class and great professor

Professor Hoban really cares about his students and is more than willing to explain concepts that aren't clear. The other half of the class is taught by Professor Hernke, but I wish Professor Hoban taught the entire class. Lots of work to study for exams, but if you put in the time and watch the videos you will do well.

Paul really cares about what he teaches. You also use real-world data to learn new concepts, which makes it more fun to learn. He only teaches half of Business Analytics II, because of how its set up, but I wish he taught the whole class! I have actually taken what I learned from him and have used it several times already this semester!

Paul really cares and it shows. He doesn't go that in depth into statistics, as the other half of the class is taught by Michael Hernke. The lectures fly by as he really makes it interesting. His online preparation videos are useful and he is there if you need him.   The level of stats needed for this class isn't that bad.

Paul's lectures were great walkthroughs of real life data that helped you understand what and why you were doing things. Overall pretty entertaining lectures given that you are just looking at him analyzing data. If you put in the time to learn excel, test won't be that tough. If you put in the time you will do just fine. GREAT PROFESSOR

Business Analytics II is a tough course, but Professor Hoban does a fantastic job of explaining the complex concepts in ways that make sense.  He's great in lecture, and even better in office hours (which he has a lot of).  He also always uses real-world data sets as examples, making his class feel much more relevant than the average stats class.
